column4: trying to apt-get usb-creator and I get the error "Couldn't find package usb-creator"... any thoughts? I'm on Ubuntu 8.04.
can u do a  sudo apt-get update and try it again?
sorry, thats what i meant
I did "sudo apt-get usb-creator"
do a sudo apt-get install usb-creator
oh man... duh!  shoot, thanks
np
Deathfox, drag and drop the theme onto the the theme changer window (appearances > theme tab)
I get the same error message
Couldn't find package usb-creator
sudo apt-get install usb-creator
do this command: sudo aptitude update; sudo aptitude install usb-creator
Seems to have worked
bumptop, the easiest thing to do is install the package "ubuntu-restricted-extras"
thanks!
good, np
Whats the difference between apt-get and aptitude?
its very little, aptitude is just newer and a bit better about cleaning up after itself
hmm... ok, thanks guys... still a noob. Obviously
Now that I have usb-creator installed, I can't find it in the menus. Is it only accessible via terminal?
its called usb somethin somethin in the system gnome menu
I checked the System > Pref and System > Admin; but I can't find the app
